intro: Premna fordii var. fordii, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or Chinese honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to China. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in moist, shady environments and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
